page.title: 13CONSERVATION IN CHILMARK
page.content: People are beginning to realise that we are losing{many native plants, {birds}and{animals. Myxamatosis}has destroyed{rabbits}though a few still live above ground.{Hares}are scarce due to{intensive farming methods. Barn {owls}are rarely seen or heard. However some people turn their gardens into sanctuaries for wild life. We put out bread and milk for hedgehogs and nuts seeds and food scraps for birds in winter. We provide bird baths and sometimes ponds where{frogs and toads may breed. Chilmark churchyard is a haven. Yews and ivy covered walls provide nesting sites. Late mowing allows Cuckoo flowers and Meadow Saxifrage to flourish. Slow worms hide amoung the stones.{Bats}live in the church roof and are protected by law. D.L.FORBES
